title: [K-12] Remote Sensing Image Caption Generation: Design and Evaluation of Self-Learning-Based Language Generation Solutions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning concepts, experience processing remote sensing data, understanding of deep learning model architectures, and introductory natural language processing (NLP) concepts (including grammar analysis, vocabulary extraction, text generation).
context.additional_context: Simulating high-quality natural language caption generation techniques with limited label data in a simulated environment, exploring methods to enhance model performance through self-learning algorithms. Applying a linguistic framework to evaluate grammatical accuracy (part-of-speech agreement, tense consistency), lexical diversity (synonym utilization, appropriateness of technical terms), and contextual appropriateness (image-text consistency, logical flow) of generated captions.

learning_goals: Improve natural language captioning model accuracy by â‰¥20% using self-supervised learning techniques (SFRC) on limited remote sensing image datasets, evaluating grammatical accuracy and lexical diversity of generated texts
Possess capabilities in designing feature extractors using BYOL-based self-supervised learning and analyzing text-image correlations, verifying contextual appropriateness of captions

Implement self-distillation processes between teacher-student models in simulation environments, conducting comprehensive evaluations of generated captions' linguistic coherence, expressiveness, and readability
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
